00002  * jcom.stats
00003  * External for Jamoma: calculate running statistical values
00004  * By Trond Lossius, Copyright © 2001-06

00010 #include "Jamoma.h"
00011 
00012 typedef struct _stats{                  // Data structure for this object 
00013         struct  object ob;                      // Must always be the first field; used by Max
00014         void    *obex;
00015         double  sumOfValues;            // Sum of values
00016         double  sumOfSquaredValues;     // Sum of squared values
00017         long    maxWindowSize;          // Maximum window size
00018         long    windowSize;                     // Actual window size
00019         long    attr_windowed;          // ATTRIBUTE: Flag indicating if we calculating windowed statistics
00020         long    valueCount;                     // Number of floats counted so far
00021         double  *values;                        // Pointer to array of values
00022         double  min;                            // Min value recorded (within the window)
00023         double  max;                            // Max value recorded (within the window)
00024         long    index;                          // Next value goes at this index in array
00025         void    *outlet;                        // Pointer to outlet. Need one for each outlet. This is for mean
00026         void    *outlet2;                       // This is for standard deviation
00027         void    *outlet3;                       // This is for counter
00028         void    *outlet4;                       // This is for min value
00029         void    *outlet5;                       // This is for max value
00030 } t_stats;
00031 
00032 
00033 
00034 // Prototypes for methods: need a method for each incoming message
00035 void *stats_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00036 void stats_free(t_stats *x);
00037 void stats_setwindowed(t_stats *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00038 void stats_bang(t_stats *x);
00039 void stats_int(t_stats *x, long n);
00040 void stats_float(t_stats *x, double f);
00041 void stats_clear(t_stats *x);
00042 void stats_window(t_stats *x, long n);
00043 void stats_set(t_stats *x, double f);
00044 void stats_assist(t_stats *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst);
00045 
00046 
00047 // Globals
00048 t_class         *this_class;            // Required. Global pointing to this class
00049 
00050 
00051 /************************************************************************************/
00052 // Main() Function
00053 
00054 int main(void)
00055 {
00056         long attrflags = 0;
00057         t_class *c;
00058         t_object *attr;
00059         
00060         jamoma_init();
00061 
00062         // Define our class
00063         c = class_new("jcom.stats",(method)stats_new, (method)stats_free, (short)sizeof(t_stats), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00064         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_stats, obex));                     
00065                 
00066         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00067 
00068         class_addmethod(c, (method)stats_bang,                          "bang",                 0);
00069         class_addmethod(c, (method)stats_int,                           "int",                  A_LONG,         0);
00070         class_addmethod(c, (method)stats_float,                         "float",                A_FLOAT,        0);             
00071         class_addmethod(c, (method)stats_assist,                        "assist",               A_CANT,         0); 
00072     class_addmethod(c, (method)stats_set,                               "set",                  A_FLOAT,        0);
00073         class_addmethod(c, (method)stats_window,                        "window_size",  A_LONG,         0);
00074     class_addmethod(c, (method)stats_clear,                             "clear",                0);
00075         class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,         "dumpout",              A_CANT,         0);  
00076     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,    "quickref",             A_CANT,         0);
00077         
00078         // ATTRIBUTE: windowed
00079         attr = attr_offset_new("windowed", _sym_long, attrflags,
00080                 (method)0, (method)stats_setwindowed, calcoffset(t_stats, attr_windowed));
00081         class_addattr(c, attr); 
00082         
00083         // Finalize our class
00084         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00085         this_class = c;
00086         return 0;
00087 }

00090 /************************************************************************************/
00091 // Object Life
00092 
00093 void *stats_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00094 {
00095         t_stats *x;
00096         
00097         
00098         x = (t_stats *)object_alloc(this_class);        // create the new instance and return a pointer to it
00099         if(x){
00100                 // Create outlets
00101         object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (object *)outlet_new(x,NULL));       // dumpout              
00102                 x->outlet5 = floatout(x);                               // 5th outlet: standard deviation
00103                 x->outlet4 = floatout(x);                               // 4th outlet: mean
00104                 x->outlet3 = floatout(x);                               // 3rd outlet: maximum
00105                 x->outlet2 = floatout(x);                               // 2nd outlet: minimum
00106                 x->outlet = intout(x);                                  // 1st outlet: counter
00107                 
00108                 // Setting max window size and actual window size
00109                 x->maxWindowSize = 0;
00110                 x->windowSize = 0;
00111                 if (argc)
00112                         x->maxWindowSize = atom_getlong(argv);
00113                 
00114                 if (argc>1)
00115                         x->windowSize = atom_getlong(argv+1);
00116                 if (x->maxWindowSize <= 0)
00117                         x->maxWindowSize = 500;                         // changing to default value
00118                 if (x->windowSize <= 0) 
00119                         x->windowSize = x->maxWindowSize;       // changing to default value
00120                 if (x->windowSize > x->maxWindowSize)
00121                         x->windowSize = x->maxWindowSize;       // making sure we do not read outside array
00122                         
00123                 // allocate memory for array                    
00124                 x->values = (double *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(double) * x->maxWindowSize);                 
00125                 if (x->values == NULL) {
00126                         error("jcom.stats: memory allocation error"); // whoops, out of memory...
00127                         return 0;
00128                 }
00129                 
00130                 x->attr_windowed = 1;                                   // set default
00131                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);               // handle attribute args                        
00132                 
00133                 stats_clear(x);                                                 // initilaize instance
00134                 return (x);                                                             // return the pointer to our new instantiation
00135         }
00136         else
00137                 return 0;
00138 }
00139 
00140 
00141 void stats_free(t_stats *x)
00142 {
00143         sysmem_freeptr(x->values);
00144 }
00145

00147 /************************************************************************************/
00148 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00149 
00150 
00151 // ATTRIBUT: set_windowed
00152 void stats_setwindowed(t_stats *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00153 {
00154         x->attr_windowed = atom_getlong(argv);
00155         stats_clear(x);
00156 }
00157 
00158 // BANG input
00159 void stats_bang(t_stats *x)
00160 {
00161         double mean, standardDeviation;
00162 
00163         if (x->valueCount < 0)
00164                 mean = 0;
00165         else 
00166                 mean = x->sumOfValues / x->valueCount;
00167         if (x->valueCount > 1)
00168                 standardDeviation = sqrt((x->sumOfSquaredValues - ((x->sumOfValues*x->sumOfValues) / x->valueCount)) / (x->valueCount - 1));
00169         else
00170                 standardDeviation = 0;
00171 
00172         outlet_float(x->outlet5, standardDeviation);
00173         outlet_float(x->outlet4, mean);
00174         outlet_float(x->outlet3, x->max);
00175         outlet_float(x->outlet2, x->min);
00176         outlet_int(x->outlet, x->valueCount);
00177 }
00178 
00179 
00180 // INT input
00181 void stats_int(t_stats *x, long n)
00182 {
00183         stats_set(x,(double)n);
00184         stats_bang(x);
00185 }
00186 
00187 
00188 // FLOAT input
00189 void stats_float(t_stats *x, double f)
00190 {
00191         stats_set(x, f);
00192         stats_bang(x);
00193 }
00194 
00195 
00196 
00197 // SET input
00198 void stats_set(t_stats *x, double f)
00199 {
00200         double old, temp;
00201         long i;
00202 
00203         // Calculating windowed statistics
00204         if (x->attr_windowed) { 
00205                 if (x->valueCount < x->windowSize)
00206                         x->valueCount++;
00207 
00208                 // Remove oldest value
00209                 old = x->values[x->index];
00210                 x->sumOfValues -= old;
00211                 x->sumOfSquaredValues -= old*old;
00212                 
00213                 // Insert new value
00214                 x->values[x->index] = f;
00215                 x->sumOfValues += f;
00216                 x->sumOfSquaredValues += f*f;
00217                 x->index++;
00218                 
00219                 // Do we need to update min or max?
00220                 if (x->valueCount == 1) {
00221                         x->min = f;
00222                         x->max = f;
00223                 }
00224                 else {
00225                         // Check new value
00226                         if (f<x->min)
00227                                 x->min = f;
00228                         if (f>x->max)
00229                                 x->max = f;
00230                         // Do we need to update min or max because we are leaving current record holder behind?
00231                         if (old==x->min) {
00232                                 temp = x->values[0];
00233                                 for (i=1; i< x->valueCount ; i++)
00234                                         if (x->values[i] < temp)
00235                                                 temp = x->values[i];
00236                                 x->min = temp;
00237                         }
00238                         
00239                         // Do we need to update min or max?
00240                         if (old==x->max) {
00241                                 temp = x->values[0];
00242                                 for (i=1; i<x->valueCount ; i++)
00243                                         if (x->values[i] > temp)
00244                                                 temp = x->values[i];
00245                                 x->max = temp;
00246                         }               
00247                 }
00248                 
00249                 // Wrap around at end of window
00250                 if (x->index >= x->windowSize)
00251                         x->index = 0;
00252         }
00253         
00254         // Calculating for infinite series
00255         else {
00256                 x->valueCount++;
00257                 x->sumOfValues += f;
00258                 x->sumOfSquaredValues += f*f;
00259                 if (x->valueCount == 1) {
00260                         x->min = f;
00261                         x->max = f;
00262                 }
00263                 else {
00264                         if (f<x->min)
00265                                 x->min = f;
00266                         if (f>x->max)
00267                                 x->max = f;
00268                 }
00269         }
00270 }
00271 
00272 
00273 void stats_window(t_stats *x, long n)
00274 {
00275         x->windowSize = n;
00276         
00277         if (x->windowSize <= 0)
00278                 x->windowSize = x->maxWindowSize;
00279         if (x->windowSize > x->maxWindowSize)
00280                 x->windowSize = x->maxWindowSize;
00281         stats_clear(x);
00282 }
00283 
00284 
00285 // CLEAR input
00286 void stats_clear(t_stats *x)
00287 {
00288         long i;
00289 
00290         x->sumOfValues = 0;
00291         x->sumOfSquaredValues = 0;
00292         x->valueCount = 0;
00293         x->index = 0;
00294         for (i=0; i<x->windowSize; i++)
00295                 x->values[i] = 0;
00296         x->min = 0;
00297         x->max = 0;
00298 }
00299 
00300 
00301 // Method for Assistance Messages
00302 void stats_assist(t_stats *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)   // Display assistance messages
00303 {
00304         if(msg==1){ 
00305                 sprintf(dst, "(int/float) function value");
00306         }
00307         else if(msg==2){
00308                 if (arg==0)
00309                         sprintf(dst, "(int) counter");
00310                 else if (arg==1)
00311                         sprintf(dst, "(float) minimum");
00312                 else if (arg==2)
00313                         sprintf(dst, "(float) maximum");
00314                 else if (arg==3)
00315                         sprintf(dst, "(float) mean");
00316                 else if (arg==4)
00317                         sprintf(dst, "(float) standard deviation");
00318                 else
00319                         strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00320         }
00321 }
